ai.summary: Coed Morgannwg Way is a short, easy hike in the UK covering 2.6 km. It is suitable for beginners and families, following gentle trails through countryside with minimal elevation and straightforward navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly even surfaces along rural footpaths, with occasional grassy fields, gravel sections or woodland edges. Expect flat to very gentle grades and easily walkable terrain in most conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for daylight hours, check the weather, and stay on marked paths. Bring water and wear sturdy footwear. Carry a basic map or GPS, a charged phone, and inform someone of your route and expected return. Be cautious of uneven ground, muddy sections when wet, and potential livestock in fields.
recommended_gear: Sturdy, comfortable walking shoes or lightweight boots
Map, compass or smartphone with offline map
Fully charged mobile phone with emergency contacts
Lightweight rain jacket or waterproof layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (year-round walkable, with best conditions typically April–September)

seo.title: Coed Morgannwg Way – Easy 2.6 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the easy 2.6 km Coed Morgannwg Way hike in the UK. This short, flat trail is ideal for beginners, with practical safety tips and gear recommendations.
